thread.title: What time is Manchester City vs Monaco, in the Champions League, how to watch live and team news
thread.title_full: What time is Manchester City vs Monaco, in the Champions League, how to watch live and team news

author: Telegraph Sport
title: What time is Manchester City vs Monaco, in the Champions League, how to watch live and team news
text:
What is it? T his is the first leg of the Champions League round-of-16 tie between Manchester City and Monaco.
When is it? It's on Tuesday night (Feb 21)
What time is kick-off? Kick-off is 19:45 GMT. Don't miss it.
When is Manchester City v Monaco? What TV channel is it on? B T Sport 2 will be broadcasting the match live from the Etihad Stadium in Manchester.
What is the team news? Vincent Kompany remains sidelined with his knee injury, and Man City manager Pep Guardiola has yet to decide whether to start with Claudio Bravo or Willy Caballero.
Is Willy Caballero going to keep Claudio Bravo out of the Manchester City starting line-up again? Credit: Jason Cairnduff/Reuters F or Monaco, the major miss is midfielder Gabriel Boschilia, whose cruciate ligament injury has ruled him out for the foreseeable future.
Gabriel Boschilia sustained his knee injury earlier in February against Metz Credit: YANN COATSALIOU/AFP/Getty What are they saying? P ep Guardiola, Man City manager: 
Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola ponders how to get the most out of what is left of his side's season Credit: Jan Kruger/Getty T o be here is not easy. I want to convince the players to enjoy that moment. It is beautiful.
People can think Manchester City have to be here but a lot of big clubs are not here. We are lucky guys.
Our recent history is quite good but over the long history, Manchester City was not here for a long time.
All of Europe will watch us, to analyse us, to kill us if we don't win or say how good we are if we do.
Leonardo Jardim, Monaco manager: 
Jardim has made much of his side's more modest resources in the build-up to this Champions League tie Credit: McNulty/JMP/REX/Shutterstock B oth sides like to keep the ball, and have loads of highly-talented technical players. They also both work hard. However, there are areas where the teams can't be compared.
One can't compare the value of both teams on the transfer market. We have players of great quality, that is true, but they have players who can be match winners on their own.
It is our 11th European match this season and the team has played the same way in all the previous ones. Perhaps the result is not always the same but that is life.
We have a DNA, we worked for that. The team will not change depending on the adversary. It is a message that I pass on to the players: whether playing [French non-league side] Chambly, PSG or Tottenham, it's always the same style.
What are the odds? Man City to win: 8/13 Draw : 10/3 Monaco to win: 9/2 Coral new customer offer: Man City to win enhanced to 7/1 >> What's our prediction? 2-1 to Man City, Monaco pinching a potentially crucial away goal.
But let's outsource this to the readers, too. How do you see it playing out?
